result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittney Christine Witzke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brittney Christine Witzke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brittney Christine Witzke was found guilty of Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

11:06 AM Judge Boles via phone.  Defendant Brittney Christine Witzke in Court pro se.  ADA Kaley Walker appeared for the State of Wisconsin w/Agent Craig T.  Includes 14CF185 & 15CM203.  ADA Walker advises of amounts due; on 14CF185 - $9,455 Restitution, $518 court costs.  On 15CM203 - $1129 court costs.  Advises that a Petition and Order to Extend Supervision has been presented by Agent, Victims are requesting restitution not be converted to civil judgment.  Defendant makes statement, questions restitution and other parties.  Court advises regarding joint/several restitution.  Court will extend Probation for two years and sign Order.  Defendant questions if paid in full if probation can be terminated.  ADA Walker states Agent would terminate probation if paid in full.  Defendant questions if Judge received certified letter from her parents. *Off record, Clerk advised we have not but Judge would not have reviewed if it was ex parte*  ADA Walker states she did not receive a copy of letter.  Court advises re: ex parte correspondence.  Defendant requests Father be able to make statement, ADA Walker objects.  States case is done and point is moot.  Court will allow, Defendant's Father makes statement.  Court advises case is done and appeal period is over.  Defendant questions Court.  Court advises he cannot give legal advice.  Adjourned at 11:15 AM
from Probation/Parole Craid Theis asking the court to review signed restitution order.
from S and A Pritchard re: asking the court consider extending probation to get the remaining $14,000 in restitution paid.
Probation review hearing on August 1, 2019 at 11:00 am.

08:53 15CF82 and 15CM203 also heard at this time. Defendant Brittney Christine Witzke in court with attorney Nicholas Von Davis.  William H. Thorie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Thorie:  plead no contest to count 2 14CF82 dismiss count 1, no contest to counts 2, 8, and 17 in 15CM203 balance of other counts dismissed and counts in 15CF82 dismissed, but dismissed counts used for PSI, restitution.  Parties agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. Defendant pleads no contest to count 2 in 14CF185.  Facts from criminal complaint support and factual basis for conviction.    COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 2 in 14CF185, court dismisses count 1 in 14CF185 but read in for sentencing. Defendant pleads guilty to counts 2, 8, and 17 in 15CM203.  Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEAS, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS. The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of counts 2, 8, and 17 in 15CM203, court orders remaining counts in 15CM203 dismissed but will be read in for sentencing and restitution.  15CF82 court orders counts dismissed but read in for sentencing. Court orders PSI and recommendation for sentence.  See JA for sentencing date. Court reviews bond conditions with the defendant. 09:18
